item.title: Incorporating Employer Tax Fields into Payroll Check Register
item.description: This month, we encountered a strange issue. A client reported a discrepancy between the payroll Check Register printed immediately after payroll posting and the same report reprinted later using Reports-Payroll-Reprint Journals-Check Register. Both the standard and reprinted Check Register reports usually combine Employer FICA taxes into a single “Employer FICA Owed” field. However, the client’s reports displayed this amount split into two additional fields: “Employer FICA/Social Security” and “Employer FICA/Medicare.” Since these fields aren’t standard, we knew the reports were customized, which we verified through Microsoft Dynamics GP customization tools.

item.title: Enjoy the Payroll FICA Fun!
item.description: I’m sharing Michael Lupro’s recent blog post about the changes to FICA rates. The post highlights the different rates for employees and employers, which may require manual adjustments in Great Plains until a system update is available to address this discrepancy. http://btosteam.blogspot.com/2011/01/manual-employer-fica-tax-calculations.html
